name: Science, engineering, and health doctorate holders employed in universities and 4-year colleges according to type of academic position, by sex, race, ethnicity, and disability status: 2019
description: Science, engineering, and health doctorate holders employed in universities and 4-year colleges according to type of academic position, by sex, race, ethnicity, and disability status: 2019

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_race_and_ethnicity_black_or_african_american
variableMeasured.description: Race And Ethnicity Black Or African American

variableMeasured.name: field_race_and_ethnicity_hispanic_or_latinoa
variableMeasured.description: Race And Ethnicity Hispanic Or Latinoa

variableMeasured.name: field_race_and_ethnicity_american_indian_or_alaska_native
variableMeasured.description: Race And Ethnicity American Indian Or Alaska Native

variableMeasured.name: field_race_and_ethnicity_native_hawaiian_or_other_pacific_islander
variableMeasured.description: Race And Ethnicity Native Hawaiian Or Other Pacific Islander

variableMeasured.name: field_race_and_ethnicity_more_than_one_raceb
variableMeasured.description: Race And Ethnicity More Than One Raceb

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Numbers rounded to nearest 50. Detail may not add to total because of rounding and suppression and because respondents could answer "yes" to more than one category of academic position. Survey of Doctorate Recipients asks the degree of difficulty—none, slight, moderate, severe, or unable to do—an individual has in seeing (with glasses); hearing (with hearing aid); walking without assistance; lifting 10 pounds; or concentrating, remembering, or making decisions. Respondents who answered "moderate," "severe," or "unable to do" for any activity were classified as having a disability.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics, Survey of Doctorate Recipients, 2019.
